00041 Matrix33::Matrix33() {
00042   data_ = new double[ 3 * 3 ];
00043 }
00044 
00045 Matrix33::Matrix33( const Matrix33& m ) {
00046   data_ = new double[ 3 * 3 ];
00047   for ( int i = 0; i < 3*3; i++ )
00048     data_[ i ] = m.data_[ i ];
00049 }
00050 
00051 Matrix33::~Matrix33() {
00052   delete[] data_;
00053 };
00054 
00055 //inline 
00056 double& 
00057 Matrix33::operator() ( int row, int col ) {
00058   return data_[ col + row * 3 ];
00059 }
00060 
00061 //inline 
00062 double 
00063 Matrix33::operator() ( int row, int col ) const {
00064   return data_[ col + row * 3 ];
00065 }
00066 
00067 //inline 
00068 Vector3 
00069 Matrix33::operator() ( int col ) const {
00070   Vector3 v;
00071   for ( unsigned i = 0; i < 3; ++i )
00072     v( i ) = ( *this ) ( i, col );
00073   return v;
00074 }

00077 Matrix33& 
00078 Matrix33::operator= ( Matrix33 const &M ) {
00079   int i;
00080   for ( i = 0;i < 3*3;i++ )
00081     data_[ i ] = M.data_[ i ];
00082   return *this;
00083 }

00087 Matrix33::operator= ( const double& x ) {
00088   int i;
00089   for ( i = 0;i < 3*3;i++ )
00090     data_[ i ] = x;
00091   return *this;
00092 }

00095 Vector3 
00096 Matrix33::operator[] ( int col ) const {
00097   Vector3 v;
00098   for ( int i = 0;i < 3;++i )
00099     v( i ) = data_[ col + i * 3 ];
00100   return v;
00101 }

00106   for ( int i = 0; i < 3*3; i++ )

00108   return *this;

00113 Matrix33::operator-=( const Matrix33& m ) {
00114   for ( int i = 0; i < 3*3; i++ )
00115     data_[ i ] -= m.data_[ i ];
00116   return *this;

00119 //inline 
00120 Matrix33 
00121 Matrix33::operator*( const double& x ) const {
00122   Matrix33 temp;
00123   for ( int i = 0; i < 3*3; i++ )
00124     temp.data_[ i ] = data_[ i ] * x;
00125   return temp;
00126 }
00127 
00128 //inline 
00129 Matrix33 
00130 Matrix33::operator/( const double& x ) const {
00131   Matrix33 temp;
00132   double ix = 1.0 / x;
00133   for ( int i = 0; i < 3*3; i++ )
00134     temp.data_[ i ] = data_[ i ] * ix;
00135   return temp;
00136 }

00138 //inline 
00139 void 
00140 Matrix33::set_diag( Vector3 diag ) {
00141   *this = 0.0;
00142   for ( unsigned i = 0; i < 3; ++i ) {
00143     ( *this ) ( i, i ) = diag( i );
00144   }
00145 }
00146 
00147 void 
00148 Matrix33::Eigen( std::vector<real>& Eval, std::vector<Vector3>& Evec ) const {
00149   //  std::cout << " in Eigen()..." << std::endl;
00150   gsl_matrix_view m = gsl_matrix_view_array( data_, 3, 3 );
00151   gsl_vector *eval = gsl_vector_alloc ( 3 );
00152   gsl_matrix *evec = gsl_matrix_alloc ( 3, 3 );
00153   gsl_eigen_symmv_workspace * w = gsl_eigen_symmv_alloc ( 3 );
00154 
00155   gsl_eigen_symmv ( &m.matrix, eval, evec, w );
00156   gsl_eigen_symmv_free ( w );
00157   //gsl_eigen_symmv_sort ( eval, evec, GSL_EIGEN_SORT_ABS_ASC );
00158   gsl_eigen_symmv_sort ( eval, evec, GSL_EIGEN_SORT_VAL_ASC );
00159 
00160   for ( unsigned i = 0; i < 3; ++i ) {
00161     //double eval_i = gsl_vector_get (eval, i);
00162     gsl_vector_view evec_i = gsl_matrix_column (evec, i);
00163     Eval.at(i) = gsl_vector_get ( eval, i );
00164         
00165     for ( unsigned j = 0; j < 3; ++j ){
00166       (Evec.at(i))(j) = gsl_vector_get( &evec_i.vector, j );
00167     }
00168   }
00169 }
00170 
00171 double 
00172 Matrix33::det( void ) const {
00173   std::vector<real> Eval;
00174   std::vector<Vector3> Evec;
00175   this->Eigen( Eval, Evec );
00176   double d = 1.0;
00177   for ( unsigned i = 0; i < 3; ++i )
00178     d *= Eval.at( i );
00179   return d;
00180 }
00181 
00182 Vector3 
00183 Matrix33::get_invariants(std::vector<Vector3> Evec) const {
00184   std::vector<real> Eval;
00185   Vector3 inv;
00186   this->Eigen(Eval,Evec);
00187   inv(0)=Eval[0]+Eval[1]+Eval[2];
00188   inv(1)=Eval[0]*Eval[1]+Eval[1]*Eval[2]+Eval[0]*Eval[2];
00189   inv(2)=Eval[0]*Eval[1]*Eval[2];
00190   return inv;
00191 }
00192 
00193 void 
00194 ROTATE(Matrix33 a,int i,int j,int k,int l,double s, double tau){
00195   double g=(a)(i,j);
00196   double h=(a)(k,l);
00197   (a)(i,j)=g-s*(h+g*tau);
00198   (a)(k,l)=h+s*(g-h*tau);
00199 }
00200 
00201 void 
00202 ROTATE(std::vector<Vector3> a,int i,int j,int k,int l, double s, double tau){
00203   double g=a.at(i)(j);
00204   double h=a.at(k)(l);
00205   a.at(i)(j)=g-s*(h+g*tau);
00206   a.at(k)(l)=h+s*(g-h*tau);
00207 }
00208 
00209 /*
00210  * calculates Eigenvalues using Jacobi algorithm
00211  * use only if Eigen() is not applicable
00212  * cf. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jacobi_eigenvalue_algorithm
00213  */
00214 void 
00215 Matrix33::Jacobi( std::vector<real>& Eval, std::vector<Vector3>& Evec, int &nrot ) {
00216   int j, iq, ip, i;
00217   double tresh, theta, tau, t, sm, s, h, g, c;
00218   double *b = new double[ 3 ],
00219     *z = new double[ 3 ];
00220 
00221   //... set output matrix to identity matrix ...
00222   for ( ip = 0; ip < 3; ip++ ) {
00223     for ( iq = 0; iq < 3; iq++ )
00224       Evec.at(ip)( iq ) = 0.0;
00225     Evec.at(ip)( ip ) = 1.0;
00226   }
00227 
00228   for ( ip = 0; ip < 3; ip++ ) {
00229     b[ ip ] = Eval[ip] = ( *this ) ( ip, ip );
00230     z[ ip ] = 0.0;
00231   }
00232   nrot = 0;
00233   for ( i = 0; i < 50;i++ ) {
00234     sm = 0.0;
00235     for ( ip = 0; ip < 2;ip++ ) {
00236       for ( iq = ip + 1;iq < 3; ++iq )
00237     sm += fabs( ( *this ) ( ip, iq ) );
00238     }
00239     if ( sm == 0.0 ) {
00240       delete[] b;
00241       delete[] z;
00242       return ;
00243     }
00244     if ( i < 4 )
00245       tresh = 0.2 * sm / ( 3 * 3 );
00246     else
00247       tresh = 0.0;
00248     for ( ip = 0; ip < 2; ip++ ) {
00249       for ( iq = ip + 1; iq < 3; iq++ ) {
00250     g = 100.0 * fabs( ( *this ) ( ip, iq ) );
00251     if ( i > 4 && ( double ) ( fabs( Eval[ip] ) + g ) == ( double ) fabs( Eval[ip] )
00252          && ( double ) ( fabs( Eval[iq] ) + g ) == ( double ) fabs( Eval[iq] ) )
00253       ( *this ) ( ip, iq ) = 0.0;
00254     else if ( fabs( ( *this ) ( ip, iq ) ) > tresh ) {
00255       h = Eval[iq] - Eval[ip];
00256       if ( ( double ) ( fabs( h ) + g ) == ( double ) fabs( h ) )
00257         t = ( ( *this ) ( ip, iq ) ) / h;
00258       else {
00259         theta = 0.5 * h / ( ( *this ) ( ip, iq ) );
00260         t = 1.0 / ( fabs( theta ) + sqrt( 1.0 + theta * theta ) );
00261         if ( theta < 0.0 )
00262           t = -t;
00263       }
00264       c = 1.0 / sqrt( 1 + t * t );
00265       s = t * c;
00266       tau = s / ( 1.0 + c );
00267       h = t * ( ( *this ) ( ip, iq ) );
00268       z[ ip ] -= h;
00269       z[ iq ] += h;
00270       Eval[ip] -= h;
00271       Eval[iq] += h;
00272       ( *this ) ( ip, iq ) = 0.0;
00273       for ( j = 0; j < ip - 1; ++j ) {
00274         ROTATE( *this, j, ip, j, iq, s, tau );
00275       }
00276       for ( j = ip + 1;j <= iq - 1; ++j ) {
00277         ROTATE( *this, ip, j, j, iq, s, tau );
00278       }
00279       for ( j = iq + 1;j < 3; ++j ) {
00280         ROTATE( *this, ip, j, iq, j, s, tau );
00281       }
00282       for ( j = 0;j < 3; ++j ) {
00283         ROTATE( Evec, j, ip, j, iq, s, tau );
00284       }
00285       ++nrot;
00286     }
00287       }
00288     }
00289     for ( ip = 0; ip < 3; ++ip ) {
00290       b[ ip ] += z[ ip ];
00291       Eval[ip] = b[ ip ];
00292       z[ ip ] = 0.0;
00293     }
00294   }
00295   std::cerr << "Error : Too many iterations in routine Jacobi";
00296   delete[] b;
00297   delete[] z;
00298 }
00299 
00300 std::vector<Vector3>
00301 Matrix33::toVecVector3() const{
00302   std::vector<Vector3> tvv;
00303   tvv.push_back(this->operator()(0));
00304   tvv.push_back(this->operator()(1));
00305   tvv.push_back(this->operator()(2));
00306 
00307   return tvv;
00308 }
